item.title: Why is OLS BLUE?
item.description: There is an aesthetic discipline to mathematics as much as there is an expectation of rigour. We shall attempt to showcase the relation between aesthetic dimension of a proof with its explanatory purchase. $\text{ “If one proves the equality of two numbers } a \text{ and } b \text{ by showing}$ $\text{ first that “} a \text{ is less than or equal to } b\text{” and then}$ $\text{“}a \text{ is greater than or equal to } b \text{”,it is unfair, one should}$ $\text{ instead show that they are really equal by disclosing the inner ground }$ $\text{ for their equality.
